properties.description: The library is conveniently situated next to the pay-and-display Station Avenue car park, behind the bus station and next door to the surgery. The bus station is served by the number 12, 13 and 555 buses. The nearby train station is only a short walk away. The library has automatic doors and all areas are accessible to wheelchairs. In addition to this, a hearing loop is available. The library also has a disabled toilet for users with a Radar key. Special software and additional hardware, such as keyboards and a lap tray, are available for those with special needs. Information and facilities at the library baby changing, family history, free help and support using IT, home library and information service, induction loop, internet and computer access, magazines and newspapers, parents' collection, photocopying, printing and scanning, study area (limited space) toilets. Activity sessions and storytimes Children's activity sessions are held at the library during school holidays. There is a storytime for under fives every Friday during term-time from 11am to 11.15am. Family history help Family History research available upon request. Filey book group Filey Book group is the last Wednesday of month and U3A is the last Thursday of the month. Information technology taster sessions The library holds information technology taster sessions to introduce people to computers and the internet. Knit and natter group The knit and natter group meets every Thursday from 1pm to 3pm. Sewing Group Our sewing group meets every Wednesday of every month from 2pm to 4pm. Soundings creative writing group The Soundings creative writing group meets on the third Thursday of the month from 10am to 12 noon. Hungry Little Minds Story times Under 5 story time, crafts and songs on Mondays from 10:30am to 11:15am, term-time only.
properties.title: Filey Library

properties.address: St Mary's Church Hall, 23 Brooklands, Filey, England, YO14 9BA, United Kingdom
